thread.title: $A slightly weaker ahead of Fed minutes
thread.title_full: $A slightly weaker ahead of Fed minutes

title: $A slightly weaker ahead of Fed minutes
text:
Mon, Aug 17, 2015, 10:45 AM AEST - Australia Markets close in 5 hrs 15 mins $A slightly weaker ahead of Fed minutes AAP â€“ 2 hours 54 minutes ago Recommend Print 
The Australian dollar is only slightly lower as traders shrug off last week's Chinese yuan devaluations and await the minutes of the Federal Reserve's July meeting. 
At 0700 AEST on Monday, the local unit was trading at 73.77 US cents, down from 73.87 cents on Friday. 
The Australian dollar lost ground last week after China devalued the yuan, also known as the renminbi, by between one and two per cent on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. 
However, there was some relief on Friday when China increased its currency's value by 0.05 per cent on Friday. 
National Australia Bank global co-head of FX strategy Ray Attrill said that brought some confidence into the market, which helped the Australian dollar cut some of its losses. 
"There's no strong signal from Friday's renminbi moves for the Australian dollar today, the overall message from Friday being that the guts of the yuan devaluation orchestrated by the People's Bank of China starting last Tuesday is probably behind us," he said. 
"We should now quickly return to fretting about the Federal Reserve." 
The minutes of the Fed's July policy meeting, due out early on Thursday morning Australian time, are expected to show that there is a general agreement among the central bank's members to soon make the first interest rate rise in nine years. 
CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 0700 AEST ON MONDAY 
One Australian dollar buys: 
* 73.77 US cents, from 73.87 cents on Friday 
* 91.69 Japanese yen, from 91.83 yen 
* 66.35 euro cents, from 66.17 euro cents 
* 112.78 New Zealand cents, from 112.83 NZ cents 
* 47.12 British pence, from 47.32 pence 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
